questions.question: What advanced imputation uses machine learning to predict missing values?
questions.explanation: Multiple imputation creates several plausible values for each missing entry.

questions.question: What technique detects multivariate outliers using distance measures?
questions.explanation: Mahalanobis distance accounts for correlation between variables.

questions.question: What method handles high-cardinality categorical features efficiently?
questions.explanation: Target encoding replaces categories with their target variable statistics.

questions.question: What transformation stabilizes variance across the range?
questions.explanation: Box-Cox finds optimal power transformation for normality.

questions.question: What technique selects features based on statistical tests?
questions.explanation: Filter methods use correlation or chi-square tests for feature selection.

questions.question: What method combines majority and minority class balancing?
questions.explanation: SMOTETomek applies SMOTE then removes Tomek links.

questions.question: What algorithm selects features by training models iteratively?
questions.explanation: RFE recursively removes least important features.

questions.question: What encoding preserves ordinal relationships in categories?
questions.explanation: Ordinal encoding maintains the natural order of categorical values.

questions.question: What technique handles temporal dependencies in missing data?
questions.explanation: Forward fill propagates last valid observation forward in time series.

questions.question: What method identifies and handles concept drift in data streams?
questions.explanation: Adaptive windowing detects distribution changes in streaming data.
